I‚Äôm reassessing my market exposure. Political risk is now being played out through financial markets. European pension funds are considering reducing U.S. debt and assets, while President Trump openly threatened retaliation in Davos if this happens.
This is power politics, not normal market behavior, and it erodes trust ‚Äî the foundation of markets.
I still believe in U.S. innovation, but the S&P 500 feels increasingly fragile: concentrated, politically sensitive, dependent on capital flows.
Personally, I prefer balance: broader global exposure, more Europe, limited thematic positions, and less reliance on one market.
This is my personal view, not investment advice.

The Big Bitcoin ( $BTC ) Supply Shock: Why It Matters The Idea: Big companies are buying so much Bitcoin that there isn't enough left for everyone else. This is changing $BTC  from a "bet" into a "savings account" for the world's richest companies.  The Facts: Massive Holdings: One major strategy now holds 709,715 BTC.  Average Cost: They bought in at around $75,979 per coin.  Huge Profits: They are currently up over $9 Billion in profit.  Why this is Bullish: Less Supply: When one group holds $63 Billion worth of Bitcoin and refuses to sell, it makes the coins left on the market much harder to find.  No Selling Pressure: Because they have so much profit, they don't need to sell. In fact, they plan to buy even more.  New Standard: We are watching Bitcoin become a "reserve asset." This means it is now seen as a safe place for big corporations to keep their money.  Bottom Line: Scarcity is winning. As supply goes down and demand goes up, the price has only one way to go.  #Bitcoin  #BTC  #MSTR  #CryptoNews  #Fundamentals

Crypto, in their framing, is a game of weighted outcomes, not bold predictions and 2026 is where several high-probability paths start to converge.  The core themes are familiar but sharper. Perp DEXs keep absorbing TradFi functions as latency drops and liquidity concentrates. #Bitcoin  Faces Resistance at $98K as Recent Buyers Sell, Glassnode Reports  $BTC  dropped beneath $90,000 after unsuccessful attempts to break through overhead supply concentrated near $98,000, according to #on-chain  data from Glassnode. The digital asset briefly climbed toward that upper threshold last week before encountering significant seller resistance.  Recent buyers holding coins near their acquisition cost provided substantial selling pressure as prices approached the $98,000 zone. #Glassnode  identified this pattern as similar to early 2022 dynamics when Bitcoin repeatedly failed to reclaim short-term holder breakeven levels, extending consolidation phases.  Holders who bought $BTC  during early and mid-2025 are now the primary source of distribution. Data shows loss realization concentrating among the three- to six-month cohort, while profit-taking activity comes from traders securing modest gains instead of maintaining positions for larger moves.  Exchange selling pressure has moderated despite the pullback. Cumulative volume delta turned more buy-dominant across major platforms, with #Coinbase -driven distribution slowing after sustained outflows during previous months.  Corporate buying remains inconsistent and tied to specific events rather than steady accumulation. Bitcoin is very slow lately and the same price range has been holding for months, no change truly. Normally, even while we recognize all of the signals and keep a bullish bias, it is still normal to wonder if Bitcoin will continue growing.

The active price range is the same since late November. Bitcoin has been moving between $84,000 to $92,000.

Now, think of this. Do you remember after the higher low 18-December how sellers couldn't produce a price below $86,000?

Regardless of all the fluctuations and the sideways range, the lowest possible was $86,400, never below, and this development is still true today.

The lowest Bitcoin has gone was $87,277, yesterday, and you can see how easily this is the final low. Last month it was $86,400, 24-Dec, this month it is ~$87,000.

We have a trading range but still, there is a clear and undeniable bullish bias. The most recent move is a higher high that peaked at a perfect level based on Fibonacci retracement; all the action is composed of higher highs and higher lows.

So, we have a bullish consolidation period, we can even say an uptrend if we consider only the short-term. This will lead to a higher high next.

The last target at $98,000 matches the 0.382 Fib. retracement level (inverted correction) on this chart. The next target is 0.618 which sits around $108,800... And that's all I have to say.

While the doubt is in the air, it is not in the chart. Trust the chart and all will be good.

The truth is that the next move has already being revealed. Bitcoin is going higher, at this point you can open LONG with any amount of leverage below 20X.

Any trading below $90,000 is a very strong buy opportunity right now. Do whatever you have to do to make the most out of this situation. It will soon be gone.

As soon as the relief rally is over Bitcoin will start to crash for months.

It is ironic to see so many bulls jumping ship to the bear side right now, Im overall bearish right now but i have jumped on board with the bulls temporarily expecting a short term rally and then most of you change to bears, It seems I was born to see things differently. Even though I am very confident we are in for one of the worst crashes later in 2026, a small rally here is simply the most logical play.

The problem is too many of you do not have a backbone. This causes you to flip back and forth on your narrative based on the hype of the week or month, which is usually designed to confuse people and manipulate markets. Do not get me wrong. Catalysts do need to be monitored. But calling every piece of data important all the time is just nonsense. It creates the noise Wall Street is after.

The key takeaway is to have a backbone you can comfortably stand on. Build a thesis off more than just a micro perspective and news narratives. Use historical analysis backed by data. Then make a decision. You will see all the volatility is just noise based off money flow and expectations.

This usually creates a predictable market that sticks to a median, ranging either higher or lower based on short term expectations, while the long term direction is driven by historical data or catalysts. 

Knowing the difference is key to keeping you sane. It forces you to rethink your thesis only if the historical data changes or a catalyst occurs. Navigating short term volatility involves understanding expectations. You simply change your short term perspective based on charting and trends. The charts show you where price expectations are, not trying to guess how much every news story will move the price. 

This is how you navigate uncertainty. You do not change your mind all the time. You learn what drives price historically, which allows you to distinguish between a catalyst and a narrative used to confuse inexperienced traders.

Analysis of on-chain data for  $BTC identifies a major liquidation cluster between $95K and $97K. This concentration of leveraged long positions means that a price push into this zone would trigger forced selling, creating strong resistance.

The structural outlook remains neutral as the asset consolidates. This overhead liquidation cluster is the key resistance defining the top of the current range. Price is likely to remain contained until this supply is cleared.

We need to understand that the real Market cycle is not just about the traditional 4-year cycle, QT Ending, QE Begins, and Rate cuts   Macro Markets move because of what we called ‚ÄúThe Business Cycle‚Äù.  The ‚Äú4-year cycle‚Äù exists because the last 3 global business cycles were 4 years  And bitcoin has always followed the global business cycle, not the halving alone.  When the business cycle topped ‚Üí BTC topped When it bottomed ‚Üí $BTC   Followed  Even the structure of BTC cycles mirrors business cycle metrics.   In the Past 3 years, it‚Äôs obvious that the Business cycle indicator is in the contraction phase (Sideways)   The indicator never broke above 55 ‚Üí crypto never went parabolic.   Why this time is different:  -US debt maturity was extended over 1.5 years after COVID rate cuts  -Logically, that likely extended the business cycle by 1.5 years too.  As long as the economy is still in a slowdown phase, explosive crypto rallies are not possible.   When the business cycle starts expanding again, that‚Äôs when Bitcoin historically makes its biggest moves.

$BTC  (1W) ‚Äì The cycle waves   Since the 2022 cycle bottom, Bitcoin has moved with remarkable consistency.  Once BTC reclaimed the 45 RSI level, the bull market started. From that point on, the cycle followed a clear rhythm: Impulse up ‚Üí consolidation ‚Üí trend reversal ‚Üí continuation  This exact sequence played out three times during this cycle: - A strong impulsive move higher - A long consolidation phase - RSI cooling off back toward the 45 level - A clean retest of 45 as support ‚Üí followed by a powerful expansion to new highs  Those long consolidations weren‚Äôt weakness. They were preparation for more upside.  Now comes the important part.  Recently, BTC was setting up to repeat this pattern for a fourth time. Momentum slowed, consolidation expanded. But this time, RSI failed to hold 45.  Instead of acting as support, the 45 level is now acting as resistance.  That‚Äôs a structural shift.  If Bitcoin wants to postpone a deeper bear phase, the condition is simple: ‚Üí RSI must reclaim 45 and hold it again  Until that happens, the rhythm that defined this entire cycle is broken.  I‚Äôm not predicting outcomes. I‚Äôm tracking structure.  Cycles don‚Äôt end because of news. They end when the rhythm changes.  And right now, that rhythm is being tested.
$BTC Bulls must reclaim fast, or a move toward $78K or even $70K zone comes into play.

Annual net realized profits are trending down.  They‚Äôve fallen to 2.5M $BTC  , the lowest level since March 2024 and similar to March 2022, when the last bear market started. Trading under ticker BPRO on the New York Stock Exchange, the Bitwise Proficio Currency Debasement ETF requires that at least one-quarter of its portfolio remain in gold holdings. The fund charges investors 0.96% annually and allows managers to adjust allocations between crypto and commodity-backed #assets  based on market conditions.   Proficio Capital Partners chief investment officer Bob Haber pointed to Goldman Sachs data that shows gold-backed exchange-traded products make up less than 1% of individual investor portfolios. He characterized gold as largely absent from contemporary investment strategies despite decades of performance history.   The fund's positioning emphasizes protecting existing wealth rather than generating outsized returns. This approach reflects broader changes in how #institutional  investors frame cryptocurrency investments as digital assets mature beyond speculative trading tools.   Currency debasement concerns have driven interest in $BTC  since its creation, with proponents arguing the asset's fixed supply makes it resistant to #inflation . Recent market data complicates this narrative, as #Bitcoin  has lagged behind gold performance in comparable timeframes.   Karel Mercx, an analyst at Netherlands-based investment advisory Beleggers Belangen, published research questioning Bitcoin's reliability as a debasement hedge. His analysis highlighted Bitcoin's failure to rally when President Donald Trump criticized Federal Reserve independence, a development that typically benefits alternative stores of value.

Bitdeer Technologies Group has officially surpassed MARA Holdings to become the largest bitcoin miner by managed hashrate. Bitdeer mined 636 $BTC  in December, up sharply from 145 BTC a year earlier, helped by its in-house SEALMINER chips, which reportedly operate at 6‚Äì7 J/TH under optimized conditions. MARA‚Äôs fleet averages closer to 19 J/TH, though direct comparisons aren‚Äôt perfectly clean.  Strategically, the two miners are diverging. Bitdeer is monetizing mined BTC to fund expansion into AI and high-performance computing, building capacity across North America, Europe, and Africa. MARA continues to hold most of its $BTC   - now over 55,000 coins, and remains focused on scaling mining itself.  The takeaway: bitcoin mining is no longer just about hashpower. Choosing the Right Exchange to Buy Bitcoin Instantly

1) What Matters When Buying  $BTC Fast
Speed is only one piece of the puzzle. When buying Bitcoin instantly, users should weigh fees (including spreads), available payment methods, security standards, and transparency. Credit/debit cards and mobile payments like Apple Pay or Google Pay are usually the fastest, but they often come with higher costs. Liquidity, proof-of-reserves, fraud protection, and customer support can matter more than raw execution speed.

2) How Major Exchanges Compare
Leading platforms such as Bitget, Coinbase, Binance, Kraken, and crypto(.)com all support instant Bitcoin purchases, but with different trade-offs. They vary in payment flexibility, fee structures, and safeguards. Some prioritize low fees via bank transfers or stablecoin conversions, while others focus on convenience with card and mobile payment options. These differences help users match an exchange to their priorities‚Äîwhether that‚Äôs cost efficiency, ease of use, or added security measures.

3) Practical Steps to Buy Bitcoin Instantly
Start by creating and securing an account with two-factor authentication. Next, select a payment method based on your balance between speed and cost. Before confirming, review the quoted price carefully to account for fees and spread. After purchase, decide whether to store Bitcoin on the exchange with verified protections or move it to a private wallet for self-custody.

Bottom line: Instant Bitcoin access is widely available, but the best exchange depends on how you value speed, cost, and security. Comparing these factors helps you act quickly without unnecessary risk.

After a significant price drop, the market is in a consolidation phase. The fundamental barrier to a recovery is a large liquidity zone overhead, which represents a potential supply ceiling that could stifle upward momentum.

Analysis of on-chain data for  $BTC identifies a major liquidation cluster between $95K and $97K. This concentration of leveraged long positions means that a price push into this zone would trigger forced selling, creating strong resistance.

What Are the Most Reliable Platforms for Buying Bitcoin Instantly?  Introduction  Buying $BTC   instantly in 2026 is easier than ever, but reliability depends on platform security, liquidity, compliance, and user experience. Choosing the right platform helps investors avoid delays, excessive fees, and custody risks while ensuring fast execution during volatile markets.  Centralized Exchanges for Instant Bitcoin Purchases?   Major centralized exchanges like Binance, Coinbase, Kraken, Bitget, OKX, Bybit, KuCoin, and Crypto(.)com remain the most reliable options for instant Bitcoin purchases. They offer deep liquidity, fiat on-ramps, card and bank integrations, and near-instant execution. These platforms suit users who prioritize speed, ease of use, and customer support, though they require trusting a custodial provider.  Decentralized and Self-Custody Alternatives?   For users focused on self-custody, decentralized platforms and wallets integrated with on-ramp services allow instant Bitcoin purchases directly to personal wallets. While they reduce counterparty risk, users must manage private keys and accept higher technical responsibility.  Key Factors to Compare Before Buying?   Investors should compare fees, payment methods, regulatory compliance, withdrawal speed, and security history. Transparency and platform reputation matter more than promotional offers.  Conclusion  The most reliable platforms for buying Bitcoin instantly balance speed, security, and transparency. Centralized exchanges dominate convenience, while self-custody options appeal to experienced users.  FAQs  Is instant Bitcoin purchase safe? Yes, on reputable platforms with strong security. Do fees vary by platform? Yes, significantly depending on payment method. Can I withdraw Bitcoin immediately? Most platforms allow instant or near-instant withdrawals.

Best security $BTC   features...

Introduction
The latest network exploit one that wiped out double-digit value and forced validators to pause the chain was another harsh reminder of crypto‚Äôs weakest link: security. It joins a long list of moments the market won‚Äôt forget, from the FTX collapse to exploits tied to Ronin and Wormhole, and even older scars like Mt. Gox.
Centralized platforms haven‚Äôt been immune either. Price swings are part of crypto‚Äôs DNA. Exchange failures shouldn‚Äôt be. 

What Really Makes an Exchanges.
Safety isn‚Äôt about branding it‚Äôs about evidence. The most reliable exchanges tend to share the same foundations: the majority of user funds held in cold storage, multi-factor and hardware-level security, transparent proof-of-reserves, a clear separation between user and company funds, insurance or protection funds for worst-case scenarios, and a clean or openly documented incident history.  
Top Safer Crypto Exchanges
Coinbase operates under strict U.S. oversight with public-company disclosures. Most assets sit in cold wallets, backed by insured hot wallets and routine audits.

Bitget has gained recognition for its defense-first approach, using multi-signature cold storage, frequent proof-of-reserves with excess coverage on major assets, ISO certifications, and a sizable on-chain protection fund.

Kraken is known for conservative operations and was an early proof-of-reserves adopter, maintaining a long breach-free track record.

Binance, despite its scale, employs cold storage, device-level protections, anti-phishing tools, and a large emergency insurance fund, though regulatory exposure varies by region.

Conclusion
In crypto, security isn‚Äôt optional. Choosing exchanges with proven safeguards and reinforcing them with disciplined personal habits remains the most reliable way to protect capital in an increasingly complex market. https://www.bitget.com/academy/most-secure-crypto-exchanges-2026

Peter Schiff: $BTC   Holders Are Losing Big While Precious Metals Hit New Records.    Economist and longtime market commentator Peter Schiff has again urged Bitcoin investors to reconsider their positions.    He insists that precious metals are sending clearer signals amid today‚Äôs shifting economic landscape. In a series of posts on X, Schiff said that while Gold and Silver continue to surge, Bitcoin has struggled to deliver comparable returns.    His comments come amid rising volatility across currency, bond, and crypto markets. He argues that such conditions tend to favor traditional stores of value.    Schiff pointed to fresh record highs in precious metals as evidence of changing investor priorities. Gold recently climbed to $4,967 per ounce, while Silver reached $99.24, with both metals setting new all-time highs.    At the same time, the U.S. Dollar Index fell to 98.37, marking a weekly decline of roughly 1%. According to Schiff, this divergence underscores mounting pressure on the dollar, reflecting heightened financial strain. It also illustrates why investors are increasingly seeking protection in hard assets.    Against this backdrop, Bitcoin has failed to keep pace, raising questions about its performance during periods of monetary stress.    As of this writing, Bitcoin was trading near $89,234, down 0.60% on the day and roughly 30% below its previous peak. Schiff contended that the primary risk for long-term holders is not a sudden market collapse. Instead, it lies in the opportunity cost of capital immobilized in an underperforming asset.    In his view, investors who remained in Bitcoin have missed substantial gains available in precious metals‚Äîa gap he described as increasingly difficult to overlook.

When Markets Reset, Signals Get Quieter

 $BTC ETFs recorded $1.22 billion in net outflows this week, the largest weekly reduction since November. In isolation, the figure suggests a meaningful shift in positioning.

Comparable outflow spikes in August 2024, March 2025, and November 2025 did not mark sustained drawdowns. Each coincided with periods where selling pressure peaked, leverage was reduced, and price action stabilized near local lows.

These moments tend to occur as markets rebalance rather than exit. Institutional vehicles adjust exposure, volatility increases, and sentiment weakens while longer-term capital often waits for clarity rather than momentum.

Mature markets rarely signal inflection points loudly. They do so through positioning and flow.

The key question isn‚Äôt the scale of the outflows.
It‚Äôs whether they represent distribution or a reset ahead of the next phase.

Which signal is the market sending this time?

$BTC  From the overall macro trend perspective, prices will only move upward going forward. Once the rise begins, it will be difficult to see meaningful pullbacks. The upward move is an inevitable trend; the key question is the form in which the broader market advances.

A break below could trigger a massive correction and signal a bear market, while a successful hold could lead to a strong upside move.

flashed a structural breakdown and it matters for the broader #Bitcoin macro flow

Gamestop's unrealized PnL flipped from a months long profit zone into a deepening loss cluster as BTC slid under the psychological range. When large holders fall below breakeven for prolonged periods, their behavior becomes reactive and can amplify volatility during liquidity thin environments.

This setup frames a critical period for BTC as price trades near cyclical equilibrium while on chain losses deepen. If forced selling appears, volatility can spike sharply.
If BTC stabilizes and reclaims momentum, these loss clusters often become fuel for aggressive reversals as positions exit capitulation

CZ in Davos: Where the crypto industry is heading
On January 22, 2026, Changpeng Zhao (CZ) spoke at the World Economic Forum and pointed out three key areas for the next phase of growth in the crypto market: tokenization, crypto payments, and artificial intelligence (AI).
According to CZ, today the only truly developed parts of the industry are exchanges and stablecoins. However, the future will be shaped by:
the tokenization of assets (including government assets),
the integration of crypto payments into traditional financial systems,
and the use of cryptocurrencies as native money for AI agents.
CZ also highlighted the size of Binance, with more than 300 million users and trading volumes higher than those of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE).
He added that the future belongs to fast and low-cost digital finance, and that physical bank branches will become less important in the coming years.
